articles.title: üìí ¬†Eloquent JavaScript Goes Fourth
articles.description: Coming several years after the third edition, the latest version of, perhaps, the best ‚Äòall rounder‚Äô book for learning JavaScript is here: ‚Äúadjusted to the realities of 2024 and generally touched up.‚Äù You can read it on the Web, but it‚Äôll be available in print later on too.
articles.author: Marijn Haverbeke

articles.title: Deno Introduces JSR: A New JavaScript Registry
articles.description: The JavaScript Registry (a.k.a. JSR) is a new TypeScript-first, ESM-only module registry designed for the entire JavaScript ecosystem. This post digs into what it‚Äôs all about and how it builds upon the success of npm.
articles.author: Dahl, Casonato, and Whinnery

articles.title: 'Apple Backs Off Killing Web Apps, But The Fight Continues'
articles.description: Last week, we linked to an open letter imploring Apple to reverse its moves around breaking PWAs.. and it worked? Whatever the case, Apple continues to seem hostile to developers, and there's more to be tackled in this area.
articles.author: Open Web Advocacy

articles.title: Ultimate Guide to Visual Testing with Playwright
articles.description: ‚ÄòUltimate‚Äô is always a gamble in a title, but this tutorial is pretty thorough and will get you several steps down the road of fetching pages and making comparisons, all from JavaScript.
articles.author: Mike Stop Continues (BrowserCat)

articles.title: Streaming HTML Out of Order Without JavaScript?
articles.description: An interesting, yet short and sweet, demo of a browser feature that enables a technique you may not have imagined possible without JavaScript ‚Äì note that support is still rather fresh in Firefox.
articles.author: Chris Haynes

articles.title: ‚ñ∂¬†¬†Drizzle ORM Explained in 100 Seconds
articles.description: The latest bitesize video from the always educational Fireship channel covers Drizzle ORM, a fast, TypeScript-based way to work with a variety of database systems across numerous JavaScript platforms, from Node to Bun, Deno Deploy, Supabase Functions, Cloudflare Workers, and more. If you need more, there‚Äôs ‚ñ∂Ô∏è a 13 minute ‚Äòcrash course‚Äô to learning Drizzle, too.
articles.author: Fireship

articles.title: JavaScript Bloat in 2024
articles.description: What‚Äôs the average size of JavaScript code downloaded per website? Spoiler alert: it‚Äôs a lot and will make anyone from the 56k dialup days cry.
articles.author: Nikita Prokopov

articles.title: Tiny Predictive Text
articles.description: Using 2MB of JavaScript with no AI or LLMs in sight (but using a variant of a Markov chain).
articles.author: Adam Grant

articles.title: Coroutines and Web Components
articles.description: ‚ÄúWe will see how coroutines can be used to model web components in a different way, and why you might like it.‚Äù
articles.author: Laurent Renard

articles.title: Million Lint: A Linter for React Performance
articles.description: Million‚Äôs mission is to make React apps faster and the new VS Code extension Million Lint takes a new approach: imagine ESLint but for suggesting performance improvements.
articles.author: Aiden Bai

articles.title: BlockNote 0.12: A 'Notion-Like' Block-Based Text Editor
articles.description: 0.12.0 is a significant release for this ProseMirror and TipTap-based editor that lets you drag and drop blocks, add real-time collaboration, add customizable ‚Äòslash command‚Äô menus, and more. It has an all new homepage, too, along with new examples.
articles.author: TypeCell

articles.title: PixiJS v8: Build Striking 2D WebGL Experiences
articles.description: PixiJS is a very mature, long standing rendering library that abstracts away all the pain of building fast 2D graphical experiences for the Web. v8 boasts significant performance improvements, a WebGPU-backed renderer, and a variety of API improvements. If you‚Äôre new to Pixi, there‚Äôs an interactive tutorial to show you the ropes.
articles.author: PixiJS Team

articles.title: NSFW JS 4.1: Client-Side Indecent Content Checking
articles.description: A client-side TensorFlow.js-powered option for detecting potentially indecent images before they even go over the wire. It‚Äôs not fool proof but may help as another layer of protection for both you and your users. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Infinite Red, Inc.

articles.title: Plotly 2.30: A JavaScript Graphing Library
articles.description: A high-level, declarative charting library, built on top of D3 and stack.gl, with over 40 chart types, including 3D charts, statistical graphs, and SVG maps.
articles.author: Plotly, Inc.

articles.title: ONBOARDING_LIB: A Headless Onboarding Library
articles.description: An onboarding library for building accessible, customizable and persisted onboarding flows in React apps. The site itself is an example of such a flow.
articles.author: Neftic Oy

articles.title: Finder 3.2: CSS Selector Generator
articles.description: Given an element, it produces the shortest possible, but precise, selector that reaches that element.
articles.author: Anton Medvedev

articles.description: JavaScript is the focus of a WIRED feature where the author ponders if JavaScript Runs the World ‚Äì Maybe Even Literally.
The OpenJS Foundation says we should care about package metadata interoperability and has put together a 'collab space' to focus on it.
üìÖ This year's JSHeroes conference takes place in Romania on May 23-24.
Is client side security dead, or a critical part of the future? asks Gal Weizman.
Node.js v21.7 (Current) ‚Äì Node gains a built-in way to output colored text, load and parse environment variables, and support multi-line values in .env files.
TypeScript 5.4 ‚Äì Improved type narrowing, the NoInfer utility type, Object.groupBy, Map.groupBy, and more.
Mermaid 10.9 ‚Äì Generate diagrams from text.
Bun v1.0.30, Vue Language Tools 2.0, Ember 5.7

articles.title: PixiJS v8: Build Striking 2D WebGL Experiences
articles.description: PixiJS is a very mature, long standing rendering library that abstracts away the pain of building fast 2D graphical experiences for the Web. v8 boasts significant performance improvements, a WebGPU-backed renderer, and a variety of API improvements. If you‚Äôre new to Pixi, there‚Äôs an interactive tutorial.
articles.author: PixiJS Team

articles.title: Apple Reverses Course on 'Death' of Progressive Web Apps in EU
articles.description: For the past couple of weeks, we‚Äôve focused on the recent, worrying developments of Apple dropping support for PWAs in iOS as a part of complying with EU regulations, but a week is a long time in the world of Web development, and Apple has ‚Äúreversed course because of numerous requests by consumers to keep the feature.‚Äù That‚Äôs one way to put it!
articles.author: Apple Insider

articles.title: WebKit Features in Safari 17.4
articles.description: Just like Safari 15.4 and 16.4, Safari 17.4 is a significant update for developers targeting users across the board, whether on desktop, phones, tablets, or even Vision Pro. CSS Scoping is a big step, there are improvements to white space and text wrapping properties, and we get support for percentages in letter-spacing and word-spacing.
articles.author: Jen Simmons and Jon Davis (WebKit)

articles.title: Safari Switching It Up with.. an HTML Switch Control
articles.description: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre very excited to introduce a new HTML form control as part of Safari 17.4: a switch.‚Äù Essentially, it slots in as a more Apple-y variant of a checkbox.
articles.author: Anne van Kesteren and Jon Davis (WebKit)

articles.title: Modern CSS Tooltips and Speech Bubbles
articles.description: Everyone knows what tooltips are, but despite their ubiquity, there‚Äôs no single, universal way to create them. The author of this post presents some modern techniques to create tooltips with the smallest amount of markup while retaining the most flexibility.
articles.author: Temani Afif

articles.title: Playing with Infinity in CSS
articles.description: Did you know CSS has an infinity constant that can be used within calc()? Never lose a z-index battle again!
articles.author: Will Boyd

articles.title: 'AI' and Accessible Frontend Components: Is the Nuance Generatable?
articles.description: Are LLMs helpful tools to assist with making accessible front-end components? A little bit of yes, but also a lot of no.
articles.author: Hidde de Vries

articles.title: Reporting Core Web Vitals with the Performance API
articles.description: The Performance API provides an interface to ways to measure and evaluate Web performance metrics from JavaScript. Geoff demonstrates how to use its features to do your own performance reporting.
articles.author: Geoff Graham

articles.title: Bugs I‚Äôve Filed on Browsers
articles.description: ‚ÄúI think filing bugs on browsers is one of the most useful things a web developer can do.‚Äù
articles.author: Nolan Lawson

articles.title: JavaScript Bloat in 2024
articles.description: What‚Äôs the average size of JavaScript code downloaded per website? Spoiler alert: it‚Äôs a lot and will make anyone from the 56k dialup days scream.
articles.author: Nikita Prokopov

articles.title: NSFW JS 4.0: Client-Side Indecent Content Checking
articles.description: The last thing most folks want uploaded to their site or app is inappropriate content. NSFW JS is an interesting client-side TensorFlow.js-powered option for detecting potentially improper content before it even reaches your server. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Infinite Red, Inc.

articles.title: Simple Icons: 3000+ Free SVG Icons for Popular Brands
articles.description: This project that we link to every year or two continues to go from strength to strength and is frequently adding new icons.
articles.author: Simple Icons

articles.title: Brainsum's Cookie Consent Bar
articles.description: Few people love them, but cookie consent messages are required in many (though not all!) circumstances and Brainsum says theirs is as compliant as it gets, and can block third party cookies without you needing to refactor your site. There‚Äôs also some support for Google‚Äôs ‚ÄòConsent mode‚Äô. ‚Äì GitHub repo.
articles.author: Brainsum

articles.title: ü©ª¬†Skeleton Generator: Generate Tailwind-Based 'Loading Skeletons' for HTML Content
articles.description: An online generator that will take your HTML structure and provide animation-based Tailwind equivalents, to display while content is loading.
articles.author: AE Studio

articles.title: üè≥¬†All Country Flags in SVG  (Plus CSS for Easier Integration)
articles.author: Panayiotis Lipiridis
